summary: The Tipped Worker Protection Act aims to amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938.  It seeks to repeal the separate minimum wage for tipped employees and sets a transitionary minimum wage starting at $3.60/hour. The bill defines and regulates tip pooling, clarifies rules surrounding mandatory service charges, and specifies employer responsibilities regarding tips, including those collected via service charges. The bill aims to increase worker pay and clarify regulations around employee tips.
